instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message:
Customer said the one USB port was intermittent then dead and now the other one is dead too.

I get power on my external drive caddy but it never it never shows up.
(I seem to have misplaced my plain-old-mouse somewhere can't test just yet for a red light).

In diode mode:

L4610::1 = 0.287
L4610::2 = 0.287
L4610::3 = 0.288
L4610::4 = 0.287

L4620::1 = 0.699
L4620::2 = 0.698
L4620::3 = 0.698
L4620::4 = 0.699

Going to search for my plain-old-mouse with a red light now.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message: Measure diode mode on data pins on the actual USB port. Pretty sure it will just be a bad L4610/20 as usual.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message:
Can an L4610 from a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> work on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

How can I tell which is Pin 1 on an L4610?

Looking at a boardview, it's like they're inverted to each other.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message: All the same, orientation does not matter either.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message:
Thanks.
Swapped L4610, no change.

USB lights up but doesn't see boot drives at boot options screen.

I have another L4610 handy, going to swap it again, just in case to see.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message:
Replaced it twice now.
No change.

threads.title: [SOLVED]82-3330 - USB not working.
threads.message:
Swapped out <DIODE>D4600</DIODE> and <DIODE>D4610</DIODE> and all is well.

Mark solved please.
